Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic text on recto and verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Mounted in eleven unnumbered frames. Provenance ? Writing. various hands and periods. several columns on both recto & verso. Contents. Frame (A). recto 5 cols. & vestiges of a previous one. a land register. verso. 21 cols. prob. a summing up of the totals of aruras on the recto. Frame (B). recto. 9 cols. list of inhabitants of houses(?). verso. 9 cols. (rougher hand). list mainly of parts of the body - often repeated. [...] list of a butcher - possibly distribution to temple officials of sacrificial animals. Frame (C). recto. 5 cols. arithmetical problems. Frame (E). recto 7 cols. list of names. cols. 1 & 2 [...] male - the rest appar. female. verso. 5 cols. accounts. Frame (F). recto 5 fragments, joined but not belonging (two mounted upside down). fragt. no. 2 - part of land register headed "The island of Pnesh year 21". etc. Date. early Roman(?). Origin. perhaps Memphis".
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. Imhausen, Mathematics in Ancient Egypt. A Contextual History (Princeton and Oxford 2016), 185-188, 193. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (55978) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/55978)
Parker 1972 / Demotic Mathematical Papyri (p. 64-72, no. 53-65, pl. 19-24.)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: stained, loss, fractured, deposit Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
